ground_truth: In the classroom next door, Harry reappears as he takes off the invisibility cloak. The moonlight, filtering through the snow on the window panes, gives the empty classroom a mysterious air. Harry looks around curiously. Through a stone arch, he glimpses a large mirror and a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond. As he walks slowly towards the mirror, he sees his own reflection getting closer. He stops in front of it and tries to read the writing carved around the wooden frame, but the words are strange and unfamiliar. Harry stands still for a moment, gazing at himself, then takes a step forward towards his reflection. To his surprise, two shadowy figures gradually appear in the mirror, standing one on each side of him: a young man and young woman. Harry turns, but the room behind him is completely empty. He looks back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously. She nods and smiles. Harry's kind-looking father beams at him. Harry stretches out a hand towards them, but his fingers only touch his reflection in the glass. As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry puts a hand on his own shoulder. His mother fondly smiles at him again. Harry looks at her sadly. Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed. In the empty classroom, they take off the invisibility cloak. They run to the mirror. With his knees tucked under his chin, Harry sits alone on the stone floor of the empty classroom, gazing into the mirror. Professor Dumbledore appears by the window. Harry gets to his feet. Dressed in a warm black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard with his pet white owl perched on his arm. The beautiful bird stretches its wings. Harry lifts his arm, and the snowy owl balances for a moment, then launches itself into the air. Harry watches as it soars above his head, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it disappears into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts. It passes the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has melted, and green grass has reappeared. Fluffy white clouds float in the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look. She finds the right page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest. He lets them in. Wearing oven gloves, Hagrid takes something out of a pot hanging there at the fire.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: In the classroom adjacent door, Harry reappears as he removes the invisibility cloak. The moonlight, filtering through the snow on the window panes, grants the vacant classroom a mysterious air. Harry glances around curiously. Through a stone arch, he glimpses a large mirror and a carved frame that descends a few steps into the chamber beyond. As he strides slowly towards the mirror, he perceives his own reflection approaching closer. He halts in front of it and attempts to read the inscription carved around the wooden frame, but the words are strange and unfamiliar. Harry stands motionless for a moment, gazing at himself, then steps forward towards his reflection. To his astonishment, two shadowy figures gradually surface in the mirror, stationed one on each flank of him: a young man and young woman. Harry pivots, but the room behind him is completely vacant. He glances back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously. She nods and smiles. Harry's kind-looking father beams at him. Harry extends a hand towards them, but his fingers only contact his reflection in the glass. As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry places a hand on his own shoulder. His mother warmly smiles at him again. Harry gazes at her sadly. Harry pulls the cover from Ron's bed. In the empty classroom, they remove the invisibility cloak. They run to the mirror. With his knees tucked under his chin, Harry sits solitary on the stone floor of the empty classroom, gazing into the mirror. Professor Dumbledore manifests by the window. Harry rises to his feet. Dressed in a warm black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard with his pet white owl perched on his arm. The beautiful bird stretches its wings. Harry raises his arm, and the snowy owl balances for a moment, then launches itself into the air. Harry observes as it soars above his head, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it vanishes into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts. It passes the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has thawed, and green grass has reappeared. Fluffy white clouds float in the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look. She locates the correct page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the perimeter of the forest. He admits them in. Wearing oven gloves, Hagrid extracts something out of a pot suspended there at the fire.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door, Harry is reappeared by the act of taking off the invisibility cloak. The empty classroom is given a mysterious air by the moonlight filtering through the snow on the window panes. Around, Harry curiously looks. Through a stone arch, a large mirror is glimpsed by him along with a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond. As he walks slowly towards the mirror, his own reflection is seen getting closer by him. In front of it, he stops and tries to read the writing carved around the wooden frame, but the words are strange and unfamiliar. Still for a moment, Harry stands, gazing at himself, then a step forward towards his reflection is taken by him. To his surprise, two shadowy figures gradually appear in the mirror, standing one on each side of him: a young man and young woman. Harry turns, but the room behind him is completely empty. The pretty young woman is looked at by him, and nervously, he swallows. She nods and smiles. At him, Harry's kind-looking father beams. A hand is stretched out by Harry towards them, but only his reflection in the glass is touched by his fingers. As the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror is put on by his mother, a hand is placed on his own shoulder by Harry. His mother smiles fondly at him again. Sadly, she is looked at by Harry. The cover is pulled off Ron's bed by Harry. In the empty classroom, the invisibility cloak is taken off by them. They run to the mirror. With his knees tucked under his chin, alone on the stone floor of the empty classroom, Harry sits, gazing into the mirror. By the window, Professor Dumbledore appears. His feet are got to by Harry. Wearing a warm black cloak and a red and gold Gryffindor scarf, the snow-covered courtyard is crossed by Harry with his pet white owl perched on his arm. Its wings are stretched by the beautiful bird. His arm is lifted by Harry, and for a moment, the snowy owl is balanced, then it launches itself into the air. As it soars above his head, Harry watches, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until the snowy owl disappears into the snow-laden sky. Now, Hogwarts is flown back towards by the white owl. The hoops of the Quidditch goal posts are passed by it. The snow has melted, and green grass has reappeared. The blue sky is floated in by fluffy white clouds. In the library, a withering look is given to Ron by Hermione. The right page is found by her. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest. They are let in by him. Wearing oven gloves, something is taken out of a pot hanging there at the fire by Hagrid.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: In the adjacent classroom, Harry removes the invisibility cloak. Moonlight filtering through snow-covered window panes gives the room a mysterious feel. Harry curiously surveys the room and spots a large mirror through a stone arch. Approaching it, he sees his reflection and tries to decipher the unfamiliar writing on the frame. Suddenly, two shadowy figures appear beside him in the mirror: a young man and woman. Turning around, he finds the room empty. The woman nods and smiles, while his father beams. Harry reaches out, but only touches the glass. His mother places a hand on his reflection's shoulder, and Harry mirrors the gesture, looking at her sadly. Harry then pulls the cover off Ron's bed, and they remove the invisibility cloak in the empty classroom, running to the mirror. Harry sits alone, gazing into it until Professor Dumbledore arrives. Dressed warmly, Harry crosses the snowy courtyard with his white owl, which takes flight, soaring above the school and disappearing into the sky. The owl returns to Hogwarts, passing Quidditch goal posts as snow melts and green grass emerges. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look and finds the right page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across wet grass to a stone cottage at the forest's edge, where Hagrid, wearing oven gloves, retrieves something from a pot over the fire.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: In the adjacent classroom, Harry removes the invisibility cloak. Moonlight through snowy windows gives the room a mysterious feel. He notices a large mirror with a carved frame. Approaching it, he sees his reflection and strange writing. Suddenly, two figures appear beside him in the mirror: a young man and woman. Turning, he finds the room empty. The woman nods and smiles, while his father beams. Harry reaches out, but only touches the glass. His mother places a hand on his reflection's shoulder, and Harry mirrors the gesture. She smiles fondly, and Harry looks sad. Harry uncovers Ron's bed, and they remove the cloak in the empty classroom, running to the mirror. Alone, Harry sits on the stone floor, gazing at the mirror. Professor Dumbledore appears. Harry stands, wearing a black cloak and Gryffindor scarf, crossing the snowy courtyard with his white owl. The owl launches into the air, soaring above the courtyard and towers, disappearing into the snowy sky. It returns to Hogwarts, passing Quidditch goal posts. Snow melts, revealing green grass and fluffy clouds. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a look, finds the right page, and they hurry across wet grass to a stone cottage. Hagrid, wearing oven gloves, removes something from a pot over the fire.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In the classroom adjacent to the one he was in before, Harry makes his reappearance as he carefully removes the invisibility cloak that had been concealing him. The soft moonlight, gently filtering through the snow-covered window panes, casts a mysterious and enchanting glow over the otherwise empty classroom. Harry, filled with curiosity, looks around the room with interest. Through a stone archway, he catches sight of a large, imposing mirror with an intricately carved frame that descends a few steps into the room beyond. As he slowly approaches the mirror, he notices his own reflection gradually coming into view. He halts in front of it and attempts to decipher the writing carved around the wooden frame, but the words are strange and unfamiliar to him. Harry stands motionless for a moment, gazing intently at his reflection, before taking a step closer towards it. To his astonishment, two shadowy figures begin to materialize in the mirror, standing on either side of him: a young man and a young woman. Harry turns around, but the room behind him remains completely empty. He looks back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously as she nods and smiles warmly at him. Harry's kind-looking father beams proudly at him. Harry reaches out a hand towards them, but his fingers only make contact with his own reflection in the glass. As his mother places her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry mirrors the gesture by placing a hand on his own shoulder. His mother smiles at him fondly once more, and Harry gazes at her with a sense of sadness. Harry then pulls the cover off Ron's bed. In the now-empty classroom, they remove the invisibility cloak. They rush eagerly to the mirror. With his knees tucked under his chin, Harry sits alone on the cold stone floor of the empty classroom, staring into the mirror. Professor Dumbledore appears by the window, and Harry quickly gets to his feet. Dressed warmly in a black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard with his pet white owl perched gracefully on his arm. The beautiful bird stretches its wings wide. Harry lifts his arm, and the snowy owl balances momentarily before launching itself into the air. Harry watches as it soars above his head, swooping gracefully around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it vanishes into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts, passing through the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has melted away, revealing the green grass beneath. Fluffy white clouds float lazily in the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look as she finds the correct page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage situated on the edge of the forest. He lets them in. Wearing oven gloves, Hagrid carefully takes something out of a pot hanging there over the fire.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In the classroom directly adjacent to the one Harry occupied previously, he reappears quietly as he carefully removes the invisibility cloak, which had been expertly concealing him until this very moment. The soft, silvery moonlight gently filters through the snow-covered window panes, casting an enchanting and mysterious glow over the otherwise empty and silent classroom. Filled with curiosity and a sense of wonder, Harry gazes around the room with keen interest. Through a stone archway, his eyes are drawn to a large, imposing mirror with a beautifully and intricately carved frame that descends several steps into the room beyond. As he approaches this mirror slowly, he notices his own reflection gradually coming into clear view. He pauses in front of it, attempting to decipher the writing etched around the wooden frame, but the words appear strange and unfamiliar to him. Harry stands still and motionless for a moment, deeply gazing at his reflection, before he takes a step closer to the mirror. To his utter amazement, two shadowy figures begin to materialize in the mirror, standing prominently on either side of him: a young man and a young woman. Harry turns around quickly, but the room behind him remains completely empty and devoid of life. He looks back at the fair young woman and swallows nervously as she nods at him and smiles warmly. His kindly father beams at him with pride. Harry reaches out a tentative hand towards them, but his fingers only make contact with his own reflection in the cold glass. As his mother places her gentle hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry mirrors the gesture by placing a hand on his own shoulder. His mother smiles at him fondly once more, and Harry returns her gaze with a profound sense of sadness. Harry then goes to pull the cover off Ron's bed. In the now-empty classroom, they remove the invisibility cloak together. They rush eagerly towards the captivating mirror once again. With his knees tucked up under his chin, Harry sits alone on the cold, hard stone floor of the empty classroom, staring deeply into the mirror's depths. Professor Dumbledore appears by the window, prompting Harry to quickly get to his feet. Dressed warmly in a black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard with his beautiful pet white owl perched gracefully on his arm. The elegant bird stretches its wings wide, preparing for flight. Harry lifts his arm, and the snowy owl balances momentarily before launching itself into the crisp air. Harry watches intently as it soars above his head, swooping gracefully around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it finally vanishes into the snow-laden sky. Soon, the white owl flies back towards the majestic Hogwarts, passing expertly through the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has melted away, revealing the lush green grass beneath. Fluffy white clouds float lazily across the expansive blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look as she finds the correct page in the book. Hermione, Harry, and Ron then hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage that is situated on the edge of the dense forest. He lets them in without hesitation. Wearing thick oven gloves, Hagrid carefully pulls something mysterious out of a pot hanging above the fire.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door, Harry reappears as he carefully removes the invisibility cloak, revealing himself to the moonlit room. The moonlight, gently filtering through the snow-covered window panes, casts a mysterious glow over the empty classroom, creating an air of intrigue. Harry, filled with curiosity, looks around the room, taking in the details. Through a stone archway, he catches sight of a large mirror with an intricately carved frame that descends a few steps into the adjoining room. As he walks slowly towards the mirror, he observes his own reflection gradually coming into view. He halts in front of the mirror, attempting to decipher the strange and unfamiliar writing carved around the wooden frame. Standing still for a moment, he gazes at his reflection, then takes a step closer, intrigued by what he sees. To his astonishment, two shadowy figures begin to materialize in the mirror, standing on either side of him: a young man and a young woman. Harry turns around to check the room behind him, but it remains completely empty. He turns back to the mirror, focusing on the pretty young woman, and swallows nervously as she nods and smiles at him. His kind-looking father beams warmly at him from the mirror. Harry, filled with emotion, stretches out a hand towards them, but his fingers only meet the cold surface of the glass. As his mother places her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry instinctively puts a hand on his own shoulder, feeling a connection. His mother smiles fondly at him once more, and Harry looks at her with a sense of sadness. Later, Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed, and together, in the empty classroom, they remove the invisibility cloak. They eagerly run to the mirror, driven by curiosity and excitement. With his knees tucked under his chin, Harry sits alone on the cold stone floor of the empty classroom, lost in thought as he gazes into the mirror. Suddenly, Professor Dumbledore appears by the window, and Harry quickly gets to his feet, acknowledging the professor's presence. Dressed warmly in a black cloak and adorned with his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard, his pet white owl perched gracefully on his arm. The beautiful bird stretches its wings, and Harry lifts his arm, allowing the snowy owl to balance momentarily before it launches itself into the air. Harry watches in awe as it soars above his head, gracefully swooping around the courtyard, then ascending over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it vanishes into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl returns, flying back towards Hogwarts, passing through the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has melted, revealing the vibrant green grass beneath. Fluffy white clouds drift lazily across the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look, her expression conveying her disapproval. She diligently searches through a book and finds the right page, her eyes lighting up with satisfaction. Hermione, Harry, and Ron then hurry across the wet grass, their footsteps quick and purposeful, as they make their way towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest. Upon reaching the cottage, they are let inside. Inside, wearing oven gloves for protection, Hagrid carefully takes something out of a pot hanging over the fire, his actions deliberate and precise.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door, Harry removes the invisibility cloak, revealing himself in the moonlit room, which has a mysterious air due to the snow-filtered light. He curiously surveys the room and notices a large mirror through a stone arch. Approaching it, he examines the unfamiliar writing on its carved wooden frame. As he stands before the mirror, his reflection is joined by two shadowy figures—a young man and woman. Turning to find the room empty, he looks back at the woman, who nods and smiles, while his father beams at him. Harry reaches out, but his fingers meet only the glass. His mother places a hand on his reflection's shoulder, prompting Harry to mirror the gesture on his own shoulder, exchanging a sad look with her. Later, Harry and Ron remove the invisibility cloak in the empty classroom and run to the mirror. Harry sits alone, gazing into it until Professor Dumbledore appears. Harry stands and, dressed warmly in his Gryffindor scarf, crosses the snowy courtyard with his pet owl. The owl takes flight, soaring above the courtyard and school towers, disappearing into the sky. It later returns to Hogwarts, flying past the Quidditch goal posts as the snow melts and green grass emerges under a blue sky. In the library, Hermione finds the right page, giving Ron a withering look. The trio hurries across the wet grass to a stone cottage at the forest's edge, where Hagrid, wearing oven gloves, retrieves something from a pot over the fire.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door, Harry reappears as he takes off the invisibility cloak, a magical garment said to be passed down through generations of wizards in folklore tales. The moonlight, filtering through the snow on the window panes, gives the empty classroom a mysterious air reminiscent of the secluded corners of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Harry looks around curiously. Through a stone arch, he glimpses a large mirror, known in Hogwarts as the Mirror of Erised, and a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond. As he walks slowly towards the mirror, he sees his own reflection getting closer. He stops in front of it and tries to read the writing carved around the wooden frame, which is an enchanting inscription designed to reveal the viewer's deepest desire, but the words are strange and unfamiliar. Harry stands still for a moment, gazing at himself, then takes a step forward towards his reflection. To his surprise, two shadowy figures gradually appear in the mirror, standing one on each side of him: a young man and young woman. Harry turns, but the room behind him is completely empty. He looks back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously. She nods and smiles, a sign of the loving support he imagines from his long-lost parents. Harry's kind-looking father beams at him, reflecting the pride Harry wishes to feel from him. Harry stretches out a hand towards them, but his fingers only touch his reflection in the glass. As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry puts a hand on his own shoulder. His mother fondly smiles at him again. Harry looks at her sadly, a poignant moment that represents his yearning for family. Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed in the Gryffindor dormitory. In the empty classroom, they take off the invisibility cloak. They run to the mirror. With his knees tucked under his chin, Harry sits alone on the stone floor of the empty classroom, gazing into the mirror. Professor Dumbledore, the wise and enigmatic headmaster of Hogwarts, appears by the window. Harry gets to his feet. Dressed in a warm black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, symbolizing his house pride, Harry crosses the snow-covered courtyard with his pet white owl, Hedwig, perched on his arm. The beautiful bird stretches its wings. Harry lifts his arm, and the snowy owl balances for a moment, then launches itself into the air. Harry watches as it soars above his head, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, a majestic sight that showcases the architectural grandeur of Hogwarts, flying higher and higher until it disappears into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts. It passes the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts, iconic features of the school's beloved sport. The snow has melted, and green grass has reappeared. Fluffy white clouds float in the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a withering look, a common expression of her exasperation with Ron's lack of focus. She finds the right page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest. He lets them in, revealing the hospitable nature of Hagrid, the gentle giant and Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts. Wearing oven gloves, Hagrid takes something out of a pot hanging there at the fire, highlighting his fondness for cooking and caring for magical creatures.

Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door Harry reappears as he takes off the invisibility cloak. The moonlight filtering through the snow on the window panes gives the empty classroom a mysterious air. Harry looks around curiously. Through a stone arch he glimpses a large mirror and a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond. As he walks slowly towards the mirror he sees his own reflection getting closer. He stops in front of it and tries to read the writing carved around the wooden frame but the words are strange and unfamiliar. Harry stands still for a moment gazing at himself then takes a step forward towards his reflection. To his surprise two shadowy figures gradually appear in the mirror standing one on each side of him. a young man and young woman. Harry turns but the room behind him is completely empty. He looks back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously. She nods and smiles. Harry's kindlooking father beams at him. Harry stretches out a hand towards them but his fingers only touch his reflection in the glass. As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror Harry puts a hand on his own shoulder. His mother fondly smiles at him again. Harry looks at her sadly. Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed. In the empty classroom they take off the invisibility cloak. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. The cat pulls the cover off a dog's bed. In the empty classroom, they take off the invisibility cloak. They run to the mirror. The cat watches as it soars above its head, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey stone towers of the school, flying higher and higher until it disappears into the snow-laden sky. Harry watches as it soars above his head, swooping around the courtyard, then up and over the grey marble spires of the school, flying higher and higher until it disappears into the cloud-filled sky. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: In the classroom next door, Harry materializes as he puts on the invisibility cloak. The moonlight, filtering through the snow on the window panes, casts the empty classroom in a whimsical light. Harry peers around cautiously. Through a stone arch, he notices a large mirror and a carved frame that rises up a few steps into the room beyond. As he skips towards the mirror, he observes his own reflection shrinking closer. He pauses in front of it and attempts to interpret the writing carved around the wooden frame, but the words are odd and unrecognizable. Harry paces for a moment, staring at himself, then takes a step backward away from his reflection. To his surprise, two shadowy figures suddenly vanish from the mirror, disappearing one on each side of him: a young man and young woman. Harry turns, but the room behind him is completely empty. He looks at the pretty young woman and breathes calmly. She waves and grins. Harry's kind-looking father applauds him. Harry retracts a hand from them, but his fingers only feel his reflection in the glass. As his mother removes her hand from the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror, Harry lowers a hand from his own shoulder. His mother fondly waves at him again. Harry glances at her happily. Harry places the cover over Ron's bed. In the empty classroom, they put on the invisibility cloak. They walk to the mirror. With his knees stretched out, Harry stands alone on the stone floor of the empty classroom, peering into the mirror. Professor Dumbledore disappears by the window. Harry drops to his feet. Dressed in a cool black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf, Harry strolls across the snow-covered courtyard with his pet white owl resting on his arm. The beautiful bird folds its wings. Harry lowers his arm, and the snowy owl balances for a moment, then glides down to the ground. Harry watches as it floats above his head, hovering around the courtyard, then down and around the grey stone towers of the school, swooping lower and lower until it vanishes into the snow-laden sky. Now, the white owl glides back towards Hogwarts. It circles the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts. The snow has returned, and green grass has vanished. Fluffy white clouds drift in the blue sky. In the library, Hermione gives Ron a delighted look. She loses the right page. Hermione, Harry, and Ron crawl across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest. He locks them out. Wearing oven gloves, Hagrid drops something into a pot hanging there at the fire.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the museum next door, Lily reappears as she takes off the camouflage tarp. The starlight, filtering through the rain on the roof tiles, gives the empty museum a mysterious air. Lily looks around curiously. Through a metal arch, she glimpses a large sculpture and a painted frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond. As she walks slowly towards the sculpture, she sees her own silhouette getting closer. She stops in front of it and tries to read the symbols carved around the metal frame, but the letters are strange and unfamiliar. Lily stands still for a moment, gazing at herself, then takes a step forward towards her silhouette. To her surprise, two shadowy plants gradually appear in the sculpture, standing one on each side of her: a young cedar and a young oak. Lily turns, but the room behind her is completely empty. She looks back at the tall young oak and swallows nervously. It nods and sways. Lily's kind-looking house beams at her. Lily stretches out a hand towards them, but her fingers only touch her silhouette in the glass. As her cedar puts its branch on the shoulder of her silhouette in the sculpture, Lily puts a hand on her own shoulder. Her cedar fondly sways at her again. Lily looks at it sadly. Lily pulls the sheet off Sam's chair. In the empty museum, they take off the camouflage tarp. They sprint to the sculpture. With her legs tucked under her chin, Lily sits alone on the metal floor of the empty museum, gazing into the sculpture. Professor Pinecone appears by the door. Lily gets to her feet. Dressed in a warm blue cloak and wearing her green and purple Ravenclaw hat, Lily crosses the rain-covered plaza with her pet grey parrot perched on her arm. The bright creature stretches its wings. Lily lifts her arm, and the grey parrot balances for a moment, then launches itself into the sky. Lily watches as it soars above her head, fluttering around the plaza, then up and over the brown brick houses of the neighborhood, flying higher and higher until it disappears into the rain-laden clouds. Now, the grey parrot flies back towards Elmhurst. It passes the hoops of the cricket goal posts. The rain has dried, and yellow daisies have reappeared. Puffy grey clouds float in the pink sky. In the gallery, Emily gives Nate a gentle look. She finds the wrong page. Emily, Lily, and Nate hurry across the dry sand towards a wooden cabin on the edge of the desert. It lets them in. Wearing gardening gloves, Mr. Cedar takes something out of a basket hanging there at the grill.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: In the laboratory down the corridor, Simon emerges as he slips off the magician's cape. The starlight, streaming through the frost on the window panes, imparts the desolate laboratory with an eerie aura. Simon glances around inquisitively. Through a marble passage, he notices a grand sculpture and a decorated pedestal that descend a few steps into the chamber beyond. As he meanders deliberately towards the sculpture, he notices his own silhouette approaching. He pauses before it and attempts to decipher the inscription etched around the metal base, but the characters are foreign and indecipherable. Simon remains motionless for a while, staring at himself, then advances a step nearer to his silhouette. To his astonishment, two indistinct silhouettes gradually materialize in the sculpture, positioned on either side of him: a teenager and a young lady. Simon rotates, but the chamber behind him is utterly vacant. He glances back at the attractive young lady and gulps nervously. She gestures and grins. Simon's amiable-looking father glows at him. Simon extends a hand towards them, but his fingers merely make contact with his silhouette in the sculpture. As his sister places her hand on the shoulder of his silhouette in the sculpture, Simon places a hand on his own shoulder. His sister warmly smiles at him again. Simon regards her wistfully. Simon removes the cover from Allen's chair. In the deserted laboratory, they shed the magician's cape. They dash to the sculpture. With his chin resting on his knees, Simon sits alone on the marble floor of the desolate laboratory, peering into the sculpture. Professor Evergreen emerges by the archway. Simon rises to his toes. Clothed in a cozy green jacket and donning his yellow and purple Hufflepuff sash, Simon traverses the frost-covered meadow with his pet black ferret perched on his shoulder. The graceful creature unfolds its wings. Simon raises his shoulder, and the dark ferret steadies momentarily, then propels itself into the breeze. Simon observes as it glides above his crown, darting around the meadow, then up and over the grey stone towers of the institution, soaring higher and higher until it vanishes into the rain-flushed horizon. Now, the dark ferret flutters back towards Hogwarts. It bypasses the rings of the Quidditch goal circles. The frost has receded, and emerald grass has resurfaced. Puffy grey clouds drift in the azure sky. In the library, Alice shoots Ben an annoyed glance. She discovers the correct passage. Alice, Simon, and Ben dash across the moist turf towards a wooden cabin on the brink of the forest. He admits them inside. Wearing gardening gloves, Gregory retrieves something from a cauldron suspended there at the hearth.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the bakery next door, Lucy materializes as she dons the camouflage hat. The sunlight, trickling through the leaves on the ceiling tiles, gives the vacant bakery a whimsical aura. Lucy glances around inquisitively. Through a wooden arch, she spots a small painting and a gilded border that descends a few steps into the space beyond. As she strolls leisurely towards the painting, she notices her own shadow approaching. She halts in front of it and attempts to decipher the symbols etched around the metal border, but the letters are peculiar and bizarre. Lucy remains motionless for a second, staring at herself, then advances a step towards her shadow. To her astonishment, two misty shapes gradually manifest in the painting, standing one on each side of her: an elderly gentleman and elderly lady. Lucy pivots, but the area behind her is entirely vacant. She glances back at the charming elderly lady and gulps apprehensively. She blinks and grins. Lucy's stern-looking uncle radiates at her. Lucy reaches out a palm towards them, but her digits merely tap her likeness in the canvas. As her uncle places his palm on the shoulder of her shadow in the painting, Lucy places a palm on her own shoulder. Her uncle affectionately grins at her once more. Lucy peers at him mournfully. Lucy yanks the blanket off Sam's cot. In the vacant bakery, they discard the camouflage hat. They dash to the painting. With her elbows tucked under her ribs, Lucy perches alone on the wooden bench of the vacant bakery, peering into the painting. Captain Sparrow emerges by the door. Lucy springs to her toes. Clad in a cozy blue jacket and adorned with her green and silver Slytherin tie, Lucy traverses the rain-soaked garden with her pet black cat nestled on her shoulder. The elegant feline extends its claws. Lucy raises her shoulder, and the striped cat clings for a second, then propels itself into the breeze. Lucy observes as it glides above her hat, zigzagging around the garden, then over and beyond the brown wooden shed of the house, speeding higher and higher until it vanishes into the cloud-filled air. Now, the striped cat drifts back towards Ravenclaw. It skims the hoops of the basketball backboards. The rain has dried, and blue flowers have emerged. Puffy grey fog floats in the pink air. In the barn, Diana hands Sam a welcoming glance. She loses the wrong book. Diana, Lucy, and Sam dash across the dry path towards a brick cabin on the brink of the desert. He invites them out. Wearing gardening gloves, Franklin takes nothing off of a pan leaving there at the stove.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry appears in an empty classroom, removing his invisibility cloak, and discovers a mysterious mirror. As he approaches, his own reflection is joined by shadowy figures of a young man and woman, his parents. Harry reaches out, but touches only glass. His mother’s reflection smiles, and Harry looks on sadly. Afterward, Harry and Ron sneak back to the mirror. Alone, Harry sits on the stone floor, entranced. Professor Dumbledore enters, and Harry leaves, crossing the snow-covered courtyard with his white owl, which soars into the sky. Seasons change as the owl returns to Hogwarts, passing Quidditch posts. Hermione, Ron, and Harry explore the grounds, eventually reaching Hagrid's cottage, where Hagrid greets them while cooking.

has melted and green grass has reappeared  It passes the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts  Now the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts  Harry and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest  As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror Harry puts a hand on his own shoulder  The moonlight filtering through the snow on the window panes gives the empty classroom a mysterious air  a young man and young woman  They run to the mirror  Wearing oven gloves Hagrid takes something out of a pot hanging there at the fire She nods and smiles  Through a stone arch he glimpses a large mirror and a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond  Harry's kindlooking father beams at him  Harry looks around curiously  Harry stands still for a moment gazing at himself then takes a step forward towards his reflection  He lets them in  Harry stretches out a hand towards them but his fingers only touch his reflection in the glass  Harry turns but the room behind him is completely empty  Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed  Professor Dumbledore appears by the window  Harry watches as it soars above his head swooping around the courtyard then up and over the grey stone towers of the school flying higher and higher until it disappears into the snowladen sky

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: They run to the mirror  With his knees tucked under his chin Harry sits alone on the stone floor of the empty classroom gazing into the mirror  Professor Dumbledore appears by the window  Harry gets to his feet  Dressed in a warm black cloak and wearing his red and gold Gryffindor scarf  Harry crosses the snowcovered courtyard with his pet white owl perched on his arm  The beautiful bird stretches its wings  Harry lifts his arm and the snowy owl balances for a moment then launches itself into the air  Harry watches as it soars above his head swooping around the courtyard then up and over the grey stone towers of the school flying higher and higher until it disappears into the snowladen sky  Now the white owl flies back towards Hogwarts  It passes the hoops of the Quidditch goal posts  The snow has melted and green grass has reappeared  Fluffy white clouds float in the blue sky  In the library Hermione gives Ron a withering look  She finds the right page  Hermione  Harry and Ron hurry across the wet grass towards a stone cottage on the edge of the forest  He lets them in  Wearing oven gloves Hagrid takes something out of a pot hanging there at the fire In the classroom next door Harry reappears as he takes off the invisibility cloak  The moonlight filtering through the snow on the window panes gives the empty classroom a mysterious air  Harry looks around curiously  Through a stone arch he glimpses a large mirror and a carved frame that goes down a few steps into the room beyond  As he walks slowly towards the mirror he sees his own reflection getting closer  He stops in front of it and tries to read the writing carved around the wooden frame but the words are strange and unfamiliar  Harry stands still for a moment gazing at himself then takes a step forward towards his reflection  To his surprise two shadowy figures gradually appear in the mirror standing one on each side of him  a young man and young woman  Harry turns but the room behind him is completely empty  He looks back at the pretty young woman and swallows nervously  She nods and smiles  Harry's kindlooking father beams at him  Harry stretches out a hand towards them but his fingers only touch his reflection in the glass  As his mother puts her hand on the shoulder of his reflection in the mirror Harry puts a hand on his own shoulder  His mother fondly smiles at him again  Harry looks at her sadly  Harry pulls the cover off Ron's bed  In the empty classroom they take off the invisibility cloak
